ray.rml

Class FloatUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • ray.rml.FloatUtil

  • final class FloatUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class for single-precision floating-point comparisons that take into account rounding errors.
    Author:
    Raymond L. Rivera

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static float EPSILON
      The value of machine epsilon, set to 2e-23f.
      static float TOLERANCE
      A default amount of tolerance for floating-point rounding errors as a more forgiving alternative to EPSILON.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static int compare(float a, float b)
      Compares the given values just like Float.compareTo(Float), but automatically taking EPSILON into account.
      static int compare(float a, float b, float tolerance)
      Compares the given values just like Float.compareTo(Float), but automatically taking a specified margin of error into account.
      static boolean isEqual(float a, float b)
      Checks whether the arguments can be considered equal to each other, using EPSILON as the default tolerance.
      static boolean isEqual(float a, float b, float tolerance)
      Checks whether the arguments can be considered equal to each other, within the given tolerance.
      static boolean isZero(float a)
      Checks whether the argument is zero, using EPSILON as the default tolerance.
      static boolean isZero(float a, float tolerance)
      Checks whether the argument is zero, within the given tolerance.

    • Field Detail

      • EPSILON

        public static final float EPSILON
        The value of machine epsilon, set to 2e-23f.
        See Also:

        public static final float TOLERANCE
        A default amount of tolerance for floating-point rounding errors as a more forgiving alternative to EPSILON.

    • Method Detail

      • compare

        public static int compare(float a,
                          float b,
                          float tolerance)
        Compares the given values just like Float.compareTo(Float), but automatically taking a specified margin of error into account.

        The margin of error is an arbitrarily small value that will be used to determine whether the distance between the arguments being compared is small enough to consider them equal.

        Parameters:
        a - The first value.
        b - The second value.
        tolerance - The margin of error.
        Returns:
        • 1 iff a > b
        • 0 iff abs(a - b) <= EPSILON
        • -1 iff a < b

      • compare

        public static int compare(float a,
                          float b)
        Compares the given values just like Float.compareTo(Float), but automatically taking EPSILON into account.

        The distance between the arguments being compared must be within EPSILON to be considered equal.

        Parameters:
        a - The first value.
        b - The second value.
        Returns:
        • 1 iff a > b
        • 0 iff abs(a - b) <= EPSILON
        • -1 iff a < b

      • isEqual

        public static boolean isEqual(float a,
                              float b,
                              float tolerance)
        Checks whether the arguments can be considered equal to each other, within the given tolerance.
        Parameters:
        a - The first value.
        b - The second value.
        tolerance - The margin of error.
        Returns:
        True if they're equal. Otherwise false.

      • isEqual

        public static boolean isEqual(float a,
                              float b)
        Checks whether the arguments can be considered equal to each other, using EPSILON as the default tolerance.
        Parameters:
        a - The first value.
        b - The second value.
        Returns:
        True if they're equal. Otherwise false.

      • isZero

        public static boolean isZero(float a,
                             float tolerance)
        Checks whether the argument is zero, within the given tolerance.
        Parameters:
        a - The value to check.
        tolerance - The margin of error.
        Returns:
        True if its distance from zero is within the margin of error. Otherwise false.

      • isZero

        public static boolean isZero(float a)
        Checks whether the argument is zero, using EPSILON as the default tolerance.
        Parameters:
        a - The value to check.
        Returns:
        True if its distance from zero is within EPSILON. Otherwise false.
